Here's that paper I believe you were talking about Kennon:

http://www.red3d.com/cwr/papers/1994/alife4.html

> fitness is the average
> distance from the target over a certain number of time steps.

Wouldn't it make more sense for the fitness function to be a function
of time spent as "it"?

Or if it were based on distance from competitors, wouldn't you want to
maximize distance from opponents while not "it", and minimize distance
from opponents when "it"?

Derek
